documentation.text:
@title SafeIBEP20
 @dev Wrappers around IBEP20 operations that throw on failure (when the token
 contract returns false). Tokens that return no value (and instead revert or
 throw on failure) are also supported, non-reverting calls are assumed to be
 successful.
 To use this library you can add a `using SafeIBEP20 for IBEP20;` statement to your contract,
 which allows you to call the safe operations as `token.safeTransfer(...)`, etc.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "SafeIBEP20: approve from non-zero to non-zero allowance"

arguments.value: SafeIBEP20: approve from non-zero to non-zero allowance

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "SafeIBEP20: approve from non-zero to non-zero allowance"

documentation.text:
@dev Deprecated. This function has issues similar to the ones found in
 {IBEP20-approve}, and its usage is discouraged.
 Whenever possible, use {safeIncreaseAllowance} and
 {safeDecreaseAllowance} instead.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "SafeIBEP20: IBEP20 operation did not succeed"

arguments.value: SafeIBEP20: IBEP20 operation did not succeed

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "SafeIBEP20: IBEP20 operation did not succeed"

Tokens that return no value (and instead revert or throw on failure) are also supported, non-reverting calls are assumed to be successful. To use this library you can add a `using SafeIBEP20 for IBEP20;` statement to your contract, which allows you to call the safe operations as `token.safeTransfer(...)`, etc.
